content: This is a great app considering what's available on android tv. I would love the option of auto playing content or a slideshow mode. Perhaps instead of having the background black maybe it would be nice to add the option for content aware backgrounds for images that don't take up the full screen. Otherwise, this is an excellent app!
I love it, thanks for building this app, you are making the world a better place!

I've been using this on my Xiaomi Mi Box 3 for a couple years now. Probably my favorite app for Android TV besides Youtube itself! Do you have any plans on releasing this on the Amazon app store so that Fire TV users will be able to access it?

There is a major issue on my Sony Bravia 4K ATV3 (kd-49xf8096). Attempting to open links to animated files (gif, gifv, webm and probably others) freezes the app. The animation does not play, I am unable to go back to the overview. The entire app freezes.  Other than that, the app awesome!
Doesn't work with smart youtube tv.

On my Sony Bravia Android TV it has a problem with animated gif files. It refuses to play many of them. It just sits playing a rotating circle as if it were having difficulty loading them. Frustrating. Also after a while of browsing I find that it repeats whole sections of Reddit posts.
please add password so i can keep others off here only me can use it

There is not much out there for browsing Reddit on your TV, so it's nice that this app exists. That being said, it seems to use an internal browser for connecting to YouTube, which is fine, but it's not possible to login to this internal app. Attempting to do so fails. So you are unable to rate, or save videos and you are forced to watch ads even if you subscribe to Red. This could use some improvement.
replyContent: HopWatch uses Google's YouTube app directly, and unfortunately these issues were caused by their app. However it looks like they have now fixed these issues, so YouTube is once again logged in to your default account while watching videos.

content: Great app but for some reason I'm not logged into YouTube when launching videos so can't Like or Subscribe etc. Please fix this if possible!
replyContent: Unfortunately this behaviour was caused by Google's YouTube app. However it looks like they have now fixed this, so YouTube is once again logged in to your default account while watching videos.

content: Excellent app for my Shield TV , thanX :)
Great app, just one complaint: Since YouTube app update videos are played via HopWatch without maintaining my YouTube login resulting in a poor experience.
replyContent: Unfortunately this behaviour was caused by Google's YouTube app. However it looks like they have now fixed this, so YouTube is once again logged in to your default account while watching videos.

content: Hasnt been updated in a while and it shows. Compare to the free apps on apple tv for reddit and its sorely missing readable comments and continuous play method, disappointed its missing.
This is one of my favorite apps on my Nexus Player since it's purchase.  There's lots of customization, great UI, card recommendations, all for keeping up with Reddit!

Excellent App.... Works perfectly on my Nvidia Shield console, I think it is the most used app on my tv.  Some room for improvement: - Auto Play next video not supported atm. - Ability to include other youtube videos. atm the app only allows you to include the main youtube channel. - Support to read comments. - Install on mobile devices.  Excellent app, I am really please with my purchase. Not expensive at all.
Very annoying that you it wont automatically play videos back to back. You have to manually open every single video.  Author has not updated it in a long time.
replyContent: Unfortunately the YouTube API on Android TV is very limited at the moment and it doesn't allow external apps to launch a playlist of videos. I've investigated a few hacky workarounds but it doesn't look like auto-play is possible. I hope that YouTube will add more functionality in the future to make this possible.

content: My favorite android tv app.

Shows a lot of potential, but I have a few crashes after little use on Shield TV, sometimes when refreshing the feed, sometimes when changing between animated gifs, also when watching several gifs some of them seem to get stuck once in a while.  Still I think the interface is great, can't really think of any usability suggestion.
replyContent: Thanks for letting me know and sorry about the problems! I'll look into it, but if it's a device-specific issue unfortunately I don't have a Shield TV to test on. If it happens again, clicking the "Report" button on the crash dialog that appears might give me some useful information.

content: Very well done.
Really solid app, it works and saves me casting reddit via my Laptop.   Thanks - Very Happy with it :)  Future Suggestion: Some kind of comments integration...
replyContent: Thanks for the suggestion! I'll consider making some comments viewable for a future update. (I don't plan to support posting comments.)

content: A bloomin brilliant app
This app rocks. It's simple and it works well. Definitely the best way to consume video content on Reddit.  But please add YouTube login, so I can find the videos I watch in my history.
replyContent: Thanks! I believe that watched videos should correctly show up in YouTube now since one of their app updates. Ping me if this isn't working for you!

content: This is my favorite app right now. The only downside is you'll spend too much time watching great vids.
Just what i was looking for!
